member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.ActiveLink.MemberFlags
member.summary: Enumeration identifying each member attribute of the active link. This enumeration and a bit vector are used in conjunction to track the set of members that need to be saved during a SetActiveLink. This ActiveLink has implementation to track its member modifications that may have been done using setters on its instance. So usually client programs need not work with this MemberFlags. However, if a client program does a GetActiveLink to fetch an object from server, alters some of its contents, then attempts to save (perhaps on a different server, or on a different form (for fields, vuis etc), or, with a different name) - in this case, the ActiveLink's change tracking implementation comes in the way of the client program's expectations. This implementation would result in sending only the explicitly updated member values back to server. To overcome this issue, client programs can set the MembersModifiedusing this enumeration to force marking all the members as modified (dirty) and thus will all be sent to server upon save attempt.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.ARForm.MemberFlags
member.summary: Enumeration identifying each member attribute of the form. This enumeration and a bit vector are used in conjunction to track the set of members that need to be saved during a SetForm. This Form has implementation to track its member modifications that may have been done using setters on its instance. So usually client programs need not work with this MemberFlags. However, if a client program does a GetForm to fetch an object from server, alters some of its contents, then attempts to save (perhaps on a different server, or on a different form (for fields, vuis etc), or, with a different name) - in this case, the Form's change tracking implementation comes in the way of the client program's expectations. This implementation would result in sending only the explicitly updated member values back to server. To overcome this issue, client programs can set the MembersModified using this enumeration to force marking all the members as modified (dirty) and thus will all be sent to server upon save attempt.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Constants
member.summary: The Constants structure defines all the values used by the AR System .NET API as constants. You use these constants to define properties for workflow actions, object properties, server information, and so on. NOTE: You should use these constant values with the classes and methods they are designed to implement. For example, you would use the AR_DPROP_* constants (like ) and their corresponding AR_DVAL_* constants with field display instance properties.

member.summary: Maximum number of actions performed if the condition defined by the query parameter is satisfied. You can specify from 1 to 25 actions in this list.

member.summary:
String specifying the equation defined by the Automation action, including nested methods and the assignment if any. For example,
$Status$ = MethodA().MethodB(MethodC()).
It is used for display only, and limited by (2000 bytes).

member.summary: Reserved for future AR System use.

member.summary: Maximum size of a user command string. (No longer used in AR System)

member.summary: Maximum size of a DDE item string.

member.summary: Maximum size of a DDE service/topic name.

member.summary: String specifying the name of the Automation server, length limited by (64 bytes).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_MAX_COM_METHOD_NAME
member.summary: Name of the OLE Automation method, length limited by (128 bytes)

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_MAX_COM_ID_SIZE
member.summary: String specifying the unique ID assigned to this server in the registry, for the interface that owns the OLE Automation method, length limited by (128 bytes).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_MAX_DEFAULT_SIZE
member.summary: Value to apply if a user submits an entry with no field value (applicable for data fields only). The default value can be as many as 255 bytes in length (limited by and must be of the same data type as the field.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_MAX_EMAIL_ADDR
member.summary: Maximum size of a notify email address.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_MAX_ENTRYID_SIZE
member.summary: The ID of the entry (padded to ). The first two bytes of this string indicate the number of Entry IDs,and the Entry ID immediately follows this number. (For example,a single Entry ID of 0000000000000006 will have an Entry ID of 010000000000000006. Join forms will have multiple Entry IDs, and the number of Entry IDs will be indicated in the first two bytes of this string.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_NATIVE_ENCRYPTION
member.summary: When exporting a definition, encrypts certain active link and char menu commands using native encryption. The commands are encrypted to prevent a user from modifying the commands and possibly cause malicious behaviors.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_UNICODE_ENCRYPTION
member.summary: When exporting a definition, encrypts certain active link and char menu commands using unicode encryption. The commands are encrypted to prevent a user from modifying the commands and possibly cause malicious behaviors.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_ENCRYPTION_VERSION
member.summary: Used by export and import to encrypt/decrypt workflow actions. The commands are encrypted to prevent a user from modifying the commands and possibly cause malicious behaviors. Used by export and import to encrypt/decrypt workflow actions. The import logic looks at the version of the encryption to decide how to decrypt the actions.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_ENCRYPTION_VERSION_2
member.summary: Used by export and import to encrypt/decrypt workflow actions. The commands are encrypted to prevent a user from modifying the commands and possibly cause malicious behaviors. Used by export and import to encrypt/decrypt workflow actions. The import logic looks at the version of the encryption to decide how to decrypt the actions. The main difference between {@link #AR_ENCRYPTION_VERSION"/> and {@link #AR_ENCRYPTION_VERSION_2"/> is that {@link #AR_ENCRYPTION_VERSION_2"/> is best used for multi-byte characters.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_NULL
member.summary: Specifies NULL value.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_KEYWORD
member.summary: An integer value identifying the particular keyword.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_INTEGER
member.summary: For data type values, represents a 32-bit signed integer value. For field limits, represents lower-and upper-range limits.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_REAL
member.summary: For data type values, represents a 64-bit floating-point value. For field limits, represents lower-and upper-range limits. You can also specify the display precision to use.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_CHAR
member.summary: For data type values, represents a null-terminated string that requires freeing allocated space. A NULL pointer of this type is equivalent to using . For field limits, represents maximum field length. Specify zero to indicate no maximum. You can also specify a character menu to attach (and whether selecting from the menu appends or overwrites text already in the field), a default query- by-example qualification type,a field character pattern,and whether the field is indexed for Full Text Search.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_DIARY
member.summary: For data type values, represents a null-terminated string that requires freeing allocated space. A NULL pointer of this type is equivalent to using . For field limits, specifies whether the field is indexed for Full Text Search.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_ENUM
member.summary: For data type values, specifies set of integer values (beginning with zero) that represents possible selection values as an indexed list. You must specify a field limit to define string values for each selection For field limits, specifies string values for an enumerated list The set of integer values (beginning with zero) represents possible selection values; and the field value limit is defined as a string of values for each selection.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_TIME
member.summary: Specifies UNIX-style date/time stamp (number of seconds since midnight January 1,1970).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_BITMASK
member.summary: For data type values, specifies a 32-bit unsigned integer value in which each bit represents a flag turned on or off. For field limits, specifies values for a bitmask not defined by AR System at this time).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_BYTES
member.summary: Specifies list of bytes containing binary data.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_DECIMAL
member.summary: For data type values, specifies a fixed-point decimal field. For field limits, specifies lower-and upper-range limits. You can also specify the precision to use.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_ATTACH
member.summary: For data type values, specifies an attachment field. For field limits, specifies the maximum size of the attachment and attachment type (embedded is the only type supported by AR System at this time).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DATA_TYPE_CURRENCY
member.summary: Specifies the currency type.

Hardware on which the process is running. This is the name each hardware vendor has given their hardware, as in the following:
On UNIX platforms, the name returned by the uname -m command (for example, sun4c). On PC platforms, the processor type (for example, PC i486).

member.summary: User must enter a keyword value pattern of any character ($LOWER$) except uppercase letters into the character field. This includes special characters, digits, and blank spaces.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REL_OP_IN

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FIXED_POINT_PRECISION
member.summary:
Normalizes all coordinate values before storing them in the database and then maps these values to pixels in the current environment upon retrieval.
Use the following algorithm to normalize coordinate values before storing them:
Normalized =(Pixel * * Static font Metric) / (Dynamic font Metric * Platform Scale)
Use this algorithm to map coordinate values to pixels upon retrieval:
Pixel =((Normalized *Dynamic font Metric / Static font Metric / Platform Scale) + ( / 2)) /
The value for is 100 on all platforms.
For additional information on , see the C API Reference Guide.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_BBOX
member.summary: A set of coordinates (X,Y) that specify the screen boundaries (bounding box) for the field (applicable for all fields except page and column fields). The first coordinate pair identifies the upper-left corner for the field. The second coordinate pair identifies the lower-right corner (see also ).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_VISIBLE
member.summary: (integer) A flag indicating the visibility of the field. Valid values for this property are 0 (hidden) and 1 (visible). The default value is 1 (visible). For control fields, this setting applies to all specified screen appearances (see ).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_ENABLE
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value identifying the enabled/disabled status of the field. For control fields, this setting applies to all specified screen appearances (see ).
Bit 0: Default -- View, select, and change. (). Bit 1: View only (data); disabled (trim or control) (). Bit 2: View, select, and change (data); enabled (trim or control) () (default setting). Bit 3: Disabled (data, trim, or control) ().

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_Z_ORDER
member.summary: (unsigned long) A value that determines the field drawing order. The value associated with each field in a view (VUI) determines the back-to-front layering of the fields on the screen (from lowest to highest). The Z-order values of all fields associated with a given view must be unique. If two or more fields have duplicate Z-order values, the system will order them at random.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_COORDS
member.summary:
A set of coordinates (X,Y) that specify the vertex location (applicable for line-and box-type trim fields only). For line-type trim fields, identify the vertices of the line segment by using two coordinate pairs. For box-type trim fields, identify the corners of the box (clockwise from the upper-left corner) by using four coordinate pairs (see also ).
To minimize display differences across a variety of operating systems and screen resolutions, the AR System clients standardize all coordinate values before storing them in the database and then map these values to the current environment upon retrieval. When specifying (or retrieving) coordinate data for any property, you must apply the same translation algorithms in order for Remedy Administrator and Remedy User to display the field correctly.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_LINE_WIDTH
member.summary: (unsigned long) The line width for the field (applicable for line-and box-type trim fields only). The default value is 3 pixels.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_LINE_PATTERN
member.summary:
(character string) NULL value. You can use the following:
-(dash) * (dot) =(double)
You can arrange these to convey pattern for example, a single dash means solid.

() Bit 3: Angle is between and when lines are joined ({@link #AR_DPROP_JOINT_STYLE"/>). () Bit 4: All straight lines smoothed when lines are joined ({@link #AR_DPROP_JOINT_STYLE"/>). ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DATA_SPIN
member.summary: (unsigned long) A flag indicating whether the field has a numeric spinner (applicable for integer fields only). Valid values for this property are 1 (TRUE) and 0 (FALSE). The default value is 0 (no numeric spinner).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DATA_MENU
member.summary: (unsigned long) A flag indicating whether the field has a drop-down list (applicable for selection fields only). Valid values for this property are 1 (TRUE) and 0 (FALSE). The default value is 0 (no drop-down list).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DATA_RADIO
member.summary: (unsigned long) A flag indicating whether the field uses radio option buttons (applicable for selection fields only). Valid values for this property are 1 (TRUE) and 0 (FALSE). The default value is 0 (does not use option buttons).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DATA_MENU_BBOX
member.summary: A set of coordinates (X,Y) that specify the screen boundaries (bounding box) for the field's menu button (applicable for character fields with an attached menu only). The first coordinate pair identifies the upper-left corner for the button. The second coordinate pair identifies the lower-right corner. The coordinates specified are relative to the field's location as specified in its property, not to the window.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DATA_EXPAND_BBOX
member.summary:
A set of coordinates (X,Y) that specify the screen boundaries (bounding box) for the field's text editor button (applicable for diary and long character fields only). The first coordinate pair identifies the upper-left corner for the button. The second coordinate pair identifies the lower-right corner. The coordinates specified are relative to the field's location as specified in its
property, not to the window.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_CHARFIELD_DISPLAY_TYPE
member.summary: A flag indicating the display type of character field. Valid values for this property are 0 (Edit) and 1 (Drop-down List). The default value is 0 (Edit).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TEXT
F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TEXT_font_STYLE
member.summary:
(character string) The name of the font style to use for a text-type trim field.
Editor: font used for data fields. Optional: font used for optional data field labels. PushButton: font used for button labels. System: font used for system-generated data field labels. RadioButton: font used for option button choices. Required: font used for required data field labels. Header1: font used for titles. Header2: font used for major headings. Header3: font used for minor headings. Note: font used for notes. Detail: font used for detail information.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TEXT_font_SIZE
member.summary: (unsigned long) The size of the font style to use for a text-type trim field. Derived from field type/option.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_HTML_TEXT
member.summary: (character string) The text for a text-type trim field that includes a URL. The string must include a standard HTML anchor tag ()that encloses the text to be linked and specifies the URL to link to. Text that does not fit within its bounding box causes the form window to scale up to accommodate it (see ).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_HTML_TEXT_COLOR
member.summary: (character string) The color of the linked text for a text-type trim field that includes a URL (see . Use one of the values listed for or specify a custom color as 0xBBGGRR, a string concatenating the two-digit hexadecimal values for blue, green, and red. The default value is the link color specified in the user's web browser preferences.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_JUSTIFY
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value indicating the horizontal justification of text within its bounding box.
1: Left-aligned () 2: Centered () 4: Right-aligned ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_ALIGN
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value indicating the vertical alignment of text within its bounding box.
1: Top-aligned (). 2: Centered () (default setting). 4: Bottom-aligned ().

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_IMAGE
member.summary:
The icon image for a toolbar-type control field. Specify a byte list type of 1 () for images in Windows bitmap (.bmp) and DIB (.dib) format. Specify 0 () for all other image formats.
Note: The only image formats currently supported on toolbar control fields are Windows bitmap and DIB. The only image size currently supported is 16 pixels wide by 15 pixels high. Images of other sizes are not scaled to fit. When creating images, use simple images and the 216-color Web palette for best results.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_PUSH_BUTTON_IMAGE
member.summary:
The icon image for a button. Specify a byte list type of 1 () for images in Windows bitmap (.bmp) and DIB (.dib) format. Specify 2 () for JPEG (.jpg or .jpeg) format.
Note: The only image formats currently supported on button fields are JPEG, Windows bitmap, and DIB. There is no limit to the pixel dimensions or file size of a button image, but large images can slow down your system's performance. When creating images, use simple images and the 216-color Web palette for best results.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_BUTTON_TEXT

member.summary: (character string) The help text for a menu-type control field. This text can be as many as 30 bytes in length (limited by ).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TOOLTIP
member.summary: (character string) The tooltip text for a toolbar-type control field. This text can be as many as 30 bytes in length (limited by ).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TOOLBAR_POS
member.summary: (unsigned long) A value that determines the toolbar position for the field (applicable for control fields only). The value associated with each field in a view (VUI) determines the left-to-right order of the icons in the toolbar (from lowest to highest, starting with one).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TOOLBAR_MODE
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value indicating the type of toolbar item (applicable for control fields only).
0: Toolbar button (). 2: Toolbar separator ().

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TOOLBAR_TEXT
member.summary: (character string) Toolbar text.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TAB_MODE
member.summary: (integer) Tab mode control. Value is AR_DPROP_CNTL_* values, for example, {@link #AR_DPROP_CNTL_TYPE"/>. Use with {@link #AR_DPROP_MENU_MODE"/>.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TAB_COORD
F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TAB_TEXT
member.summary: (unsigned long) Tab text.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TAB_ORDER
member.summary: A value that determines the field tab order for fields in view (from lowest to highest).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DATETIME_POPUP
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value indicating the display type of a date/time field. The default value is 0 (both date and time).
0: Both date and time () (default setting). 1: Time only (). 2: Date only ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_DATETIME_BOTH
member.summary: Date/time field displays both date and time.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_DATETIME_TIME
member.summary: Date/time field displays time only.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_DATETIME_DATE
member.summary: Date/time field displays date only.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_BACKGROUND_MODE
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value indicating whether the background of a field is opaque or transparent.
0: Opaque () (default value) 1: Transparent ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_BKG_MODE_OPAQUE
member.summary: Specifies background of field is opaque.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_BKG_MODE_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies background of field is transparent.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TAB_NEXT
member.summary: (unsigned long) (ARInternalId) Inter-field keyboard relationships. x,y order. Can include tab switch.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DATA_BBOX
member.summary: A set of coordinates (X,Y) that specify the screen boundaries (bounding box) for the field's data area (applicable for data fields only). For example, this property locates the entry box for a character foeld and the buttons for a radio button selection field. The forst coordinate pair identifies the upper-left corner for the data area. The second coordinate pair identifies the lower-right corner. The coordinates specified are relative to the field's location as specified in its property, not to the window or page containing it.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_VIEW_GRID_BBOX
member.summary: A set of X,Y coordinates (0,0), (25,25) of the grid for the bounding box.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_VUI_DEFAULT
member.summary: (unsigned long) A flag identifying the default view (VUI) for the form. A value of 1 identifies the default VUI (with all other VUIs having a value of 0). The system uses the first VUI returned if you do not specify a default view.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_PANE_LAYOUT
member.summary:
(integer) A value indicating how the panes of the VUI are arranged. This property also specifies whether the layout is locked to prevent the user from changing it.
-1: Results pane left of details, prompt pane on top, locked. -2: Details pane left of results, prompt pane on top, locked. -3: Results pane above details, prompt pane on top, locked. -4: Details pane above results, prompt pane on top, locked. -5: Results pane left of details, prompt pane on bottom, locked. -6: Details pane left of results, prompt pane on bottom, locked. -7: Results pane above details, prompt pane on bottom, locked. -8: Details pane above results, prompt pane on bottom, locked. 1: Results pane left of details, prompt pane on top, unlocked. 2: Details pane left of results, prompt pane on top, unlocked. 3: Results pane above details, prompt pane on top, unlocked. 4: Details pane above results, prompt pane on top, unlocked. 5: Results pane left of details, prompt pane on bottom, unlocked. 6: Details pane left of results, prompt pane on bottom, unlocked. 7: Results pane above details, prompt pane on bottom, unlocked. 8: Details pane above results, prompt pane on bottom, unlocked.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DETAIL_PANE_VISIBILITY
member.summary:
A value indicating the visibility of the detail pane of the VUI.
0: Pane hidden but can be visible () 1: Pane visible but can be hidden () 2: Pane always visible () 3: Pane always hidden ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PANE_ALWAYS_HIDDEN
member.summary: Detail pane is always hidden

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PANE_HIDDEN
member.summary: Detail pane is hidden but can be made visible

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PANE_VISIBLE
member.summary: Detail pane is visible but can be hidden

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PANE_ALWAYS_VISIBLE
member.summary: Detail pane is always visible

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_PROMPT_PANE_VISIBILITY
member.summary: Determines whether the three detail pane properties (detail pane, result pane, and prompt pane visibility) are used or not.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_RESULT_PANE_VISIBILITY
member.summary: Determines whether the three detail pane properties (detail pane, result pane, and prompt pane visibility) are used or not.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DETAIL_PANE_COLOR
member.summary: (character string) The background color of the details pane. Specify the color as #BBGGRR, a string concatenating the two-digit hexadecimal values for blue, green, and red.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DETAIL_PANE_IMAGE
member.summary:
The background image for the details pane.
Specify a byte list type of 1 () for images in Windows bitmap (.bmp) and DIB (.dib) format. Specify 2 () for JPEG (.jpg or .jpeg) format (see ).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_IMAGE_ALIGN
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value indicating the vertical alignment of the background image for the details pane.
1: Top-aligned (). 2: Centered () (default setting). 3: Expand to fill (). 4: Bottom-aligned (). 5: Tile to fill ().

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_IMAGE_JUSTIFY
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value indicating the horizontal justification of the background image for the details pane.
1: Left-aligned (). 2: Centered (). 3: Expand to fill (). 4: Right-aligned (). 5: Tile to fill ().

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DISPLAY_PARENT
member.summary: (unsigned long) A value indicating the parent field that the field will display in. Specify the field ID of the parent. A page holder field is the parent of the page fields displayed in it, and a page field is the parent of the fields displayed in it. A value of 0 indicates that the field's parent is the form view and not another field. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_PAGE_ORDER
member.summary: (unsigned long) Order of appearence of a page.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_PAGE_LABEL_DISPLAY
member.summary:
(boolean integer) Field/value pair for position on page holder where page labels should appear. For example, use with {@link #AR_DVAL_PAGE_DISPLAY_TOP"/>.
0: Top () 1: Bottom () 2: Left () 3: Right () 4: Only one page exposed without any label ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PAGE_DISPLAY_TOP
member.summary: Sets page label to appear on top.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PAGE_DISPLAY_BOTTOM
member.summary: Sets page label to appear on bottom.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PAGE_DISPLAY_LEFT
member.summary: Sets page label to appear on left.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PAGE_DISPLAY_RIGHT
member.summary: Sets page label to appear on right.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PAGE_DISPLAY_NONE
member.summary: No page label appears.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_PAGE_ARRANGEMENT
member.summary:
(boolean integer) Field/value pair for how pages should be displayed if pages cannot fit in page holder. For example, use with {@link #AR_DVAL_PAGE_SCROLL"/>.
0: Scroll to view the page () 1: View as layers of pages ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PAGE_SCROLL
member.summary: Lets users scroll to view the pages if pages cannot fit in page holder.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_PAGE_LAYER
member.summary: Lets users view page fields as layers of pages if pages cannot fit in page holder.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DEFAULT_PAGE
member.summary: Field ID of page field. First page is default, otherwise.

member.summary:
The icon image for the title bar.
Specify a byte list type of 1 () for images in Windows bitmap (.bmp) and DIB (.dib) format. Specify 2 () for JPEG (.jpg or .jpeg) format.

member.summary: (character string) A short,plural form of the name for the logical items represented by entries in the form this view is associated with (see ).

member.summary: (character string) A very short, singular form of the name for the logical items represented by entries in the form this view is associated with (see )

member.summary: (character string) A very short,plural form of the name for the logical items represented by entries in the form this view is associated with (see )

member.summary: (character string) A list of administrator-defined searches. It is encoded in the same format as qualifications in .arf files. This is reserved for future AR System use.

member.summary: (character string) A list of client interface items an administrator can control. It is encoded in the same format as qualifications in .arf files. This is reserved for future AR System use.

member.summary: (unsigned long) Field ID of field to use for ID of this ticket for display purposes

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_QUERY_LIST_COLOR
member.summary: (character string) The name of the field whose value for a given entry controls the display color of that entry in a query results list, and a list of field values and their corresponding colors. This is reserved for future AR System use.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_COLUMN_WIDTH
member.summary: (integer) The width of a column in a table field.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_COLUMN_ORDER
member.summary: (integer) The order of a column in a table field. The column with the lowest value will be the left-most displayed.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_SORT_SEQ
member.summary: (integer) The sort order of a column in a table field. The system will sort based on the column with the lowest value first. To keep from sorting based on a column, specify 0 (the default).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_SORT_DIR
member.summary:
(integer) A value indicating the sort direction of a column in a table field.
Specify 0 for ascending (). Specify 1 for descending ().

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_SORT_DIR_ASCENDING
member.summary: Sort direction of column in table field is ascending.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_SORT_DIR_DESCENDING
member.summary: Sort direction of column in table field is descending.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_DRILL_DOWN
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A bitmask indicating whether drill-down is enabled for a table field.
Specify bit 0 to disable. () Specify 1 to enable. () When drill-down is enabled and a user double-clicks a row in the table field, a Modify window opens for the entry represented by that row.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_DRILL_DOWN_NONE
member.summary: Value that denies users the ability to double-click a row in table field to open source request of row in modify mode.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_DRILL_DOWN_ENABLE
member.summary: Value that allows users to double-click a row in table field to open source request of row in modify mode.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_REFRESH
member.summary:
(integer) Table field refresh enabled.
0: Value that denies users the ability to refresh table data when the request in which the table is embedded appears in the Details pane. () 1: Value that allows users to refresh table data when the request in which the table is embedded appears in the Details pane, according to the maximum defined for table field. This feature can definitely impact performance. ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_REFRESH_NONE
member.summary: Value that denies users the ability to refresh table data when the request in which the table is embedded appears in the Details pane.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_REFRESH_TABLE_MAX
member.summary: Value that allows users to refresh table data when the request in which the table is embedded appears in the Details pane, according to the maximum defined for table field. This feature can definitely impact performance.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_AUTO_REFRESH
member.summary:
(unsigned long) A value indicating whether automatic refresh is enabled (applicable for table fields only).
Specify 0 to disable () Specify 1 to enable (). When automatic refresh is enabled, the contents of the table field will be updated when the entry is displayed in a Modify window. When automatic refresh is disabled, the table appears empty until the user clicks within its borders to refresh it.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_AUTO_REFRESH_NONE
member.summary: Disables auto-refresh for table fields.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_AUTO_REFRESH_TABLE_MAX
member.summary: Enables auto-refresh for table fields.

member.summary: Allow horizontal scrollbar in table field

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_AUTOFIT_COLUMNS_NONE
member.summary: No Scrollbar appears. Remedy User will auto-scale the column width

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_AUTOFIT_COLUMNS_SET
member.summary: Scrollbar will be enabled in the Table Field when displayed in Remedy User.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TABLE_DISPLAY_TYPE
member.summary:
Field/value pair to display table fields in web browser. Dictates the appearance of a table field on the web.
0: Sets table to look like table in web browser () 1: Sets the table to look like a results list in the web browser. () 2: Sets the table to look like a notification alert in the web browser. ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_TABLE_DISPLAY_TABLE
member.summary: Sets the table to look like a table in the web browser. Displays the table as a regular table on the web.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_TABLE_DISPLAY_RESULTS_LIST
member.summary: Sets the table to look like a results list in the web browser. Displays the table as a query list (results) table on the web.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_TABLE_DISPLAY_NOTIFICATION
member.summary: Sets the table to look like a notification alert in the web browser. Displays the table as an alert table on the web.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TABLE_SELINIT
member.summary:
Field/value pair controlling initial selection in results list and table fields.
0: Selects and fires workflow in initial selection in results list and table fields. () 1: Selects but does not fire workflow in initial selection in results list and table fields. () 2: No selection in results list and table fields. ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_TABLE_SELINIT_SELFIRE
member.summary: Selects and fires workflow in initial selection in results list and table fields.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_TABLE_SELINIT_SELNOFIRE
member.summary: Selects but does not fire workflow in initial selection in results list and table fields.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DVAL_TABLE_SELINIT_NOSEL
member.summary: No selection in results list and table fields.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DPROP_TABLE_SELREFRESH
member.summary:
Field/value pair for refreshing table fields.
0: When table field is refreshed, selection is refreshed and workflow is fired. () 1: When table field is refreshed, selection is refreshed but workflow is not fired. () 2: When table field is refreshed, select first entry, then workflow is fired. () 3: When table field is refreshed, select first entry but workflow is not fired. () 4: When table field is refreshed, no entry is selected. ()

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_NOTIFY_VIA_XREF
member.summary:
Notifications sent according to specified field cross-reference for notify mechanism.
0 -- Do not notify ({@link #AR_NOTIFY_NONE AR_NOTIFY_NONE"/>) 1 -- Remedy Alert ({@link #AR_NOTIFY_VIA_NOTIFIER AR_NOTIFY_VIA_NOTIFIER"/>) 2 -- Email ({@link #AR_NOTIFY_VIA_EMAIL AR_NOTIFY_VIA_EMAIL"/>) 3 -- User default ({@link #AR_NOTIFY_VIA_DEFAULT AR_NOTIFY_VIA_DEFAULT"/>)
You can also enter a maximum notify priority where users are notified using the mechanism specified. Enter a numeric value between 4 and 98 to indicate the mechanism to use. This number writes the notification to the file [ar_install_dir]\arserver\db\notify[nn].arn where nn is the number that you entered.

member.summary: Enables the user to read the data field value but not to access the value, or to enter/modify data in the field. The field value and the field label will be grayed out.

member.summary: Specify layout of report. (?)

member.summary: Fields to include in the report from the Field List in the upper half of the dialog box.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_NAME
member.summary: Name of report.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_TITLE
member.summary: Title that appears at top of report in Remedy User.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_HEADER
member.summary: Header that appears at top of every page of report in Remedy User.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_FOOTER
member.summary: Footer that appears at bottom of every page of report in Remedy User.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_LINES
member.summary: Specifies how many lines of page the report will occupy.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_TOP
member.summary: Specify the number of blank lines you want at the top of each page of your report (including the header and title, if any). The default is 1.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_BOTTOM
member.summary: Specify the number of blank lines you want at the bottom of each page of your report (including the footer, if any). The default is 1.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_CHARS
member.summary: Specify the maximum number of characters on a line.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_LEFT
member.summary: Specify the number of blank character units you want from the left edge of the page. The default is 0.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_RIGHT
member.summary: Specify the number of blank character units you want from the right edge of the page. The default is 0.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_COL_SEP
member.summary: Specify characters to be used as separators between columns in a column or compressed text formatted report. The default value is a space.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_ONE_REC_PER_PAGE
member.summary: Forces a page break after each request.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_COMPRESSED
member.summary: Creates report in compressed format with commas between the columns (or with white space or any other specified character between the columns).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_TITLE_SEP_CHAR
member.summary: Specify characters to be uses to separate the column title (the field name) from the data below. The default is a hyphen (-). This setting applies only to column-formatted reports.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_REC_SEP
member.summary: Specify characters you want to use to separate requests. By default, they are blank.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_LONG_FIELD_FORMAT
member.summary:
Specify whether to wrap or truncate long field format.
Wrap -- Any information that does not fit on a single line is continued on the next line within the same column. A row may consist of more than one line of output. Truncate -- If the information in a field does not fit in the column width you defined for the field, the information is truncated.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_COL_TITLE_PER
member.summary:
Specify where column title appears in the report.
None means the column title will not appear, and your prototype will appear blank in the Style Preview pane. Request places the column title above each request. Page places the column title at the top of each page. "Group_Name" appears only if you created a group in the Sort tab. This option places the column title above each specified group.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_REPORT_ATTR_PAGE_BREAKS
member.summary:
Specify where page breaks appear in report.
None sets no artificial page breaks. Page breaks depend on the destination, such as the printer. Request forces a page break after each request. Page forces a page break after each page as defined by lines per page setting. "Group_Name" appears only if you created a group in the Sort tab. This option forces a break after each group you have defined.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_INFO_SCC_COMMENT_CHECKOUT
member.summary: Integer (0 or 1) value indicating whether or not a source code control integration requires you to entire a comment at checkout time. A 0 value means no comment is required.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_INFO_SCC_INTEGRATION_MODE
member.summary: Integer (0 or 1) value indicating the level of source code control integration. A 0 (the default) value indicates an advisory level of integration, which means you can modify and save an object without having it checked out from the source code control application. A 1 value means enforced integration, which has strict rules for controlling source files (for example, enforced integration means that other administrators will not be able to modify and save changes on an object that you have checked out).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_INFO_DB_MAX_ATTACH_SIZE
member.summary: The maximum size (in bytes) for attached files in the Oracle RDBMS. The default value is 2 GB. The maximum value allowed is limited by your server operating system and configuration.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_INFO_DB_MAX_TEXT_SIZE
member.summary: The maximum size (in bytes) allowed for long character text data in Oracle, SQL Server, and Sybase databases. For Oracle databases, this value is also used for memory allocation during the processing of long text data; therefore, you must use it conservatively. The default for an Oracle database is 1 MB. For SQL Server and Sybase, the default is 2,147,483,647 bytes. The max value allowed for either DB is 2,147,483,647 bytes.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_INFO_GUID_PREFIX
member.summary: The character string used as a prefix for GUID strings that are generated by filters.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_INFO_MULTIPLE_ARSYSTEM_SERVERS
member.summary: A flag indicating whether you want to run multiple servers on one host machine. Valid values for this option are T and F. To run multiple servers, you must set this option to T in the configuration file for each server you are running. The default value is F (you are not running multiple servers on one machine). -------------------------------------------------------------- Note:If you set this option to T and are running prev versions of AR System applications, such as DSO or the Approval Server, those applications will not work. You must upgrade your applications if you want them to work with this option.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_INFO_ORACLE_BULK_FETCH_COUNT
member.summary: Defines the number of the rows of data fetched at a time from the result set when querying an Oracle database. The minimum is 1, the maximum is 100, and the default is 50. Higher the value, more memory is used during data retrieval

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_DEBUG_SERVER_USER
member.summary: Bitmask indicating the type of logging (user) to set. Logs information about connection activity for each user. Information includes the time that each user logs in, whether the user is able to obtain a license,and when each floating license is released. This enables you to keep an audit trail of user activity to help you determine if you need more floating licenses.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_STAT_TIMES_BLOCKED
member.summary:
(integer) Total number of instances in which at least one process was blocked by the current process. This statistic, in conjunction with the
statistic, enables you to determine the approximate number of processes being blocked per instance.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_SERVER_STAT_NUMBER_BLOCKED
member.summary:
(integer) Total number of blocked processes. This statistic, in conjunction with the
statistic, enables you to determine the approximate number of processes being blocked per instance. For example,if
is three and
is six, the six blocked processes could be distributed in three possible ways:
Two blocked processes in each of the three instances (2+2+2=6). Three blocked processes in one instance,two blocked processes in one instance,and one blocked process in one instance (3+2+1=6). Four blocked processes in one instance and one blocked process in both of the other two instances (4+1+1=6).
In this example,the blocked processes could not be distributed as five in one instance, one in one instance, and none in one instance because, by definition, the number of instances represents those times when at least one process is blocked.

member.summary: The collection directory for the FTS engine. This directory contains all defined FTS indexes. This directory is not used if no fields are indexed for FTS.

member.summary: A structure that contains all defined words to ignore for the FTS collection.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXTINFO_REINDEX
member.summary: A value indicating whether the system rebuilds FTS indexes. Valid values for this option are 0 (no) and 1 (yes). The default value is 0 (do not rebuild).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXTINFO_CASE_SENSITIVE_SRCH
member.summary: A value indicating whether full text searches are case-sensitive. Valid values for this option are 0 (case-sensitive) and 1 (case-insensitive). The default value is 1 (case-insensitive).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXTINFO_STATE
member.summary: A value indicating whether FTS is enabled. Valid values for this option are 0 (off)and 1 (on). The default value is 1 (FTS on).

member.summary: Indicates type of FTS match operation.

member.summary: Sets FTS home directory.

member.summary: Sets FTS debugging.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXT_REINDEX
member.summary: Reindex the FTS collection.

member.summary: Full Text Search case sensitive searching.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_CASE_INSENSITIVE_SEARCH
member.summary: Full Text Search case insensitive searching.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXT_FTS_MATCH_FORCE_L_T_WILD
member.summary: Append leading and trailing wild cards to every word. This option produces the highest number of matches but slows performance the most.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXT_FTS_MATCH_FORCE_T_WILD
member.summary: Truncate all leading wild cards and append trailing wild cards to every word. This option produces a reasonable number of matches while still being efficient.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXT_FTS_MATCH_IGNORE_L_WILD
member.summary: Truncate all leading wild cards (do not truncate or append trailing wild cards).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXT_FTS_MATCH_REMOVE_WILD
member.summary: Truncate all wild cards. This option is the most efficient match operation type but produces the lowest number of matches.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_FULLTEXT_FTS_MATCH_UNCHANGED
member.summary: Leave all wild cards as specified by the user. This option requires that users understand both how to use wild cards and their impact on performance.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_MAX_RESERVED_FIELD_ID
member.summary: Internal ID of the field to create. The IDs of all fields and form views (VUIs) associated with a given form must be unique. Specify 0 for this parameter if you want the system to generate and return the ID. Otherwise, specify a value between 536870912 and 2147483647 (limited by ). If you specify a reserved ID, the system generates an error unless the parameter is set to 1 (TRUE).

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Constants.AR_RESERV_FORM_ACTION_SUBMIT
member.summary: Submit is one of the reserved fields in the Remedy Administrator Preferences schema from the Web View tab. It is a "form action" field that you can add to the web view of a form. These form action fields that may have workflow already associated with them, or they may invoke servlets at runtime. They are displayed with a label in the browser, and perform the appropriate standard function on the web client.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Container.MemberFlags
member.summary: Enumeration identifying each member attribute of the container. This enumeration and a bit vector are used in conjunction to track the set of members that need to be saved during a SetContainer. This Container has implementation to track its member modifications that may have been done using setters on its instance. So usually client programs need not work with this MemberFlags. However, if a client program does a GetContainer to fetch an object from server, alters some of its contents, then attempts to save (perhaps on a different server, or on a different form (for fields, vuis etc), or, with a different name) - in this case, the Container's change tracking implementation comes in the way of the client program's expectations. This implementation would result in sending only the explicitly updated member values back to server. To overcome this issue, client programs can set the MembersModifiedusing this enumeration to force marking all the members as modified (dirty) and thus will all be sent to server upon save attempt.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Menu.MemberFlags
member.summary: Enumeration identifying each member attribute of the menu. This enumeration and a bit vector are used in conjunction to track the set of members that need to be saved during a SetMenu. This Menu has implementation to track its member modifications that may have been done using setters on its instance. So usually client programs need not work with this MemberFlags. However, if a client program does a GetMenu to fetch an object from server, alters some of its contents, then attempts to save (perhaps on a different server, or on a different form (for fields, vuis etc), or, with a different name) - in this case, the Menu's change tracking implementation comes in the way of the client program's expectations. This implementation would result in sending only the explicitly updated member values back to server. To overcome this issue, client programs can set the MembersModifiedusing this enumeration to force marking all the members as modified (dirty) and thus will all be sent to server upon save attempt.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Escalation.MemberFlags
member.summary: Enumeration identifying each member attribute of the escalation. This enumeration and a bit vector are used in conjunction to track the set of members that need to be saved during a SetEscalation. This ActiveLink has implementation to track its member modifications that may have been done using setters on its instance. So usually client programs need not work with this MemberFlags. However, if a client program does a GetActiveLink to fetch an object from server, alters some of its contents, then attempts to save (perhaps on a different server, or on a different form (for fields, vuis etc), or, with a different name) - in this case, the ActiveLink's change tracking implementation comes in the way of the client program's expectations. This implementation would result in sending only the explicitly updated member values back to server. To overcome this issue, client programs can set the MembersModifiedusing this enumeration to force marking all the members as modified (dirty) and thus will all be sent to server upon save attempt.

member.name: P:BMC.ARSystem.Field.AuditOption
member.summary: A bitmask that indicates whether the field should be audited or copied when other fields are audited. Bit 0: Audit this field. (AR_FIELD_BITOPTION_AUDIT) Bit 1: Copy this field when other fields in the form are audited. (AR_FIELD_BITOPTION_COPY) Bit 2: Indicates this field is for Log Key 1. (AR_FIELD_BITOPTION_LOG_KEY1) Bit 3: Indicates this field is for Log Key 2. (AR_FIELD_BITOPTION_LOG_KEY2) Bits 2 and 3: Indicates this field is for Log Key 3. (AR_FIELD_BITOPTION_LOG_KEY3)

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Filter.MemberFlags
member.summary: Enumeration identifying each member attribute of the filter. This enumeration and a bit vector are used in conjunction to track the set of members that need to be saved during a SetFilter. This Filter has implementation to track its member modifications that may have been done using setters on its instance. So usually client programs need not work with this MemberFlags. However, if a client program does a GetFilter to fetch an object from server, alters some of its contents, then attempts to save (perhaps on a different server, or on a different form (for fields, vuis etc), or, with a different name) - in this case, the Filter's change tracking implementation comes in the way of the client program's expectations. This implementation would result in sending only the explicitly updated member values back to server. To overcome this issue, client programs can set the MembersModifiedusing this enumeration to force marking all the members as modified (dirty) and thus will all be sent to server upon save attempt.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Server
member.summary: Represents an AR System server. All server access is handled by calling methods on an instance of this class.
member.remarks:
The BMC.ARSystem.Server class is the main class in this assembly. An Server instance represents a connection to a specific AR System server as a particular user.
COM clients should use the "BMC.ARSystem.Server" progid to instantiate an instance of this object. Using this approach to access this object via IDispatch binding is required, as opposed to VTBL binding by referencing the type library. See the VBScript code example below.
Mult-threaded clients of this API should create one Server instance per thread.

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a new Server

member.overloads: Login to a specific AR System server
member.summary: Login to a specific AR System server

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.Login(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Login to a specific AR System server
member.param: Server name
User name
Password
Authentication string
member.example:
[C#]
BMC.ARSystem.Server arserver = new BMC.ARSystem.Server(); arserver.Login("localhost", "Demo", "", "");
[VBScript]
Dim arserver Set arserver = CreateObject("BMC.ARSystem.Server") arserver.Login "localhost", "Demo", "", ""

member.summary: Login method that allows supplying the logged in user's charSet
member.param: Server name
User name
Password
Authentication string
represented as a string of the form "lang_COUNTRY.codeset@modifiers" (OR) can be specified as null or empty string for pre-7.0 server interaction
UTF-8 or null/empty string
The port number used to communicate with the AR System server. This parameter is overridden by the ARTCPPORT environment variable.

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.Login(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This is a remedy internal routine. Prefer to use other Login methods OR use it only for debugging purposes. This Login method sets up the underlying C AR API in a way that all the C AR API calls can be logged into two log files - one for the issued API calls including their input argument data and another file capturing the response data from those API calls.
member.param: Server name
User name
Password
Authentication string
Represented as a string of the form "lang_COUNTRY.codeset@modifiers" (OR) can be specified as null or empty string for pre-7.0 server interaction
UTF-8 or null/empty string
The port number used to communicate with the AR System server. This parameter is overridden by the ARTCPPORT environment variable.
File path to indicating where the AR System API commands should be logged to
File path to indicating where the AR System API results should be logged to
True - indicates log the initialization and termination calls as well. False - exclude logging them

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server._performLogin(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reserved for Internal Use.

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.Logout
member.summary: Logout and immediately call ARTermination, which is otherwise performed only when ARSystem.Server is finalized by the garbage collector.
member.example:
[C#]
server.Logout();
[VBScript]
server.Logout

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.VerifyUser(System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determine whether the user is a member of the Administrator, SubAdministrator, and Customize groups
member.param: Set to non-zero if the user is an administrator
Set to non-zero if the user is a sub-administrator
Set to non-zero if the user is a member of the Customize group
member.remarks: This method is not callable from COM automation. However, ARSystem.Server.IsAdministrator is available for this purpose.

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetServerPort(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify the port used to communicate with the AR System Server, or whether to use a private server
member.param: The port number used to communicate with the AR System server. This parameter is overridden by the ARTCPPORT environment variable.
The RPC program of the AR System server. This parameter is overridden by the ARRPC environment variable.
member.example:
[C#]
server.SetServerPort(0, 390600);
[VBScript]
server.SetServerPort 0, 390600

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.LockToAdminPort
member.summary: Connect to the server using the admin port. Use this whenever your application performs admin operations and always needs to retrieve the most up to date definitions from the server cache.

member.summary: Connect the the server on the default port, using the list or fast server queue

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.ExpandMenu(System.String,BMC.ARSystem.FieldValueList)
member.summary: Expand a menu (such as a query menu, SQL menu, etc.)
member.param: The name of the menu to expand

Field values to substitute (if any) in the query menus. For example, a menu qualification such as "'Status' > $536870913$" need to be preprocessed by substituting the screen value for $536870913$ field, before attempting menu expansion. This parameter allows for supplying such field values.

ARSystem.FieldValueList fieldValueList = new ARSystem.FieldValueList(); fieldValueList[8] = "Some Description"; fieldValueList[2] = "Test"; server.SetEntryByQuery(".NET Unit Test", "'First Name' LIKE \"Appajee%\"", false, SetEntryByQuery_NoMatchOption.NoAction, SetEntryByQuery_MultiMatchOption.ModifyAll, fieldValueList);
[VBScript]
Dim fieldValueList Set fieldValueList = CreateObject("BMC.ARSystem.FieldValueList") fieldValueList.Item(8) = "Some Description" fieldValueList.Item(2) = "Test" server.SetEntryByQuery ".NET Unit Test", \ "'First Name' LIKE \"Joe%\"", false, \ SetEntryByQuery_NoMatchOption.NoAction, \ SetEntryByQuery_MultiMatchOption.ModifyAll, \ fieldValueList

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.ImportARXData(System.String,BMC.ARSystem.Server.MergeDuplicateOption,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

overloads.summary:
Import data from an ARX format data export file using MergeEntry for each record.
Attachment data should be store in a sub-folder, if attachment fields are included in the export file.
There are five events associated with this method, which can be used to tie into the import process. See , , , , and .

member.param: Input file
Whether to supress the filter processing while importing
Whether to use field default values as a fallback, if NULL data is encountered in the data

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.ImportARXData(System.String,System.String,BMC.ARSystem.Server.MergeDuplicateOption,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: Input file
ARForm into which to import the data
Option for handling of duplicate records
Whether to skip required field check and allow NULL data in required fields.
Whether to skip pattern validation rules
Whether to supress the filter processing while importing
Whether to use field default values as a fallback, if NULL data is encountered in the data

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.ImportARXData(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32[0:,0:],System.UInt32,BMC.ARSystem.Server.MergeDuplicateOption,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: Input file
Applicable if the ARX file contains data from more than one form. In which case, this parameter indicates the form name whose data be picked up from the file
Target form on the server, into which the data be imported
Applicable only if fileForm and targetForm are specified. This is a two dimensional array specifying how the fields be mapped between source form fields to the target form

Specifies a field id which be used to identify matching entries. Typically this is Request Id (Field id = 1), but there may be cases where the import operation is to be performed such a way that the incoming entries are matched with the existing entries using a different field (such as the GUID field, for example)
Option for handling of duplicate records
Whether to skip required field check and allow NULL data in required fields.
Whether to skip pattern validation rules
Whether to supress the filter processing while importing
Whether to use field default values as a fallback, if NULL data is encountered in the data

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.ImpersonateUser(System.String)
member.summary: Impersonate a specific user and make subsequent API calls on behalf of the given user. This call can only be used by an Admin privilege user (in that only admin can impersonate another user). Calling this method again with a different user name, will change the currently impersonated user to the new user name. Calling this method with a 'null' would result in stoppage of impersonation.

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.ImpersonateEnd
member.summary: Stop impersonating. Applicable only if an ImpersonateUser call were successfully made previously.

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.BeginBulkEntryTransaction
member.summary: Initiates a bulk entry transaction. Once this call is made - all subsequent create, delete, set, merge entry operations will be batched together and all of them will be issued only when a SendBulkEntryTransaction call is made. To cancel the bulk txn mode without sending the transaction request to server, CancelBulkEntryTransaction method should be used.

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SendBulkEntryTransaction
member.summary: Sends all the batched entry requests, in a bulk transaction, to server.
member.returns: An array list of BulkEntryReturn instances each of which describe one operation within the bulk entry transaction

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.CancelBulkEntryTransaction
member.summary: Cancel previously initiated bulk entry transaction mode, without sending the batched entry requests (if any) to server
member.returns: An array list of BulkEntryReturn instances each of which describe one operation within the bulk entry transaction

member.name: M:BMC.ARSystem.Server.GetLastBulkEntryTransactionReturnList
member.summary: Get the last bulk transaction operation's resultant status details.
member.returns: An array list of BulkEntryReturn instances each of which describe one operation within the bulk entry transaction

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Server.FieldDeleteOption
member.summary: Field deletion handling options for any field deletion calls.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.FieldDeleteOption.cleanDelete
member.summary: 0 - Do not delete the specified field if it contains data (applicable for base forms only) or is associated with a join form.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.FieldDeleteOption.dataDelete
member.summary: 1 - Delete the specified field if it contains data but not if it is associated with a join form.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.FieldDeleteOption.forceDelete
member.summary: 2 - Delete the specified field, all join form fields that map to it, and all join forms dependent on it for join qualification.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_NoMatchOption
member.summary: Allows for specifying how a SetEntryByQuery should work in case of no matches were to be found for a given qualification.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_NoMatchOption.Error
member.summary: Return an error if no matches occur.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_NoMatchOption.NoAction
member.summary: Do nothing (Push Fields action only) if no matches occur.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_NoMatchOption.SubmitEntry
member.summary: Submit a new entry (Push Fields action only) if no matches occur.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_MultiMatchOption
member.summary: Allows for specifying a SetEntryByQuery should work in case of multiple matches were to be found for a given qualification.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_MultiMatchOption.Error
member.summary: Return an error if multiple matches occur.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_MultiMatchOption.ModifyFirst
member.summary: Assign a value from the first matching entry if multiple matches occur.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_MultiMatchOption.PickList
member.summary: Display a selection list (active links only) if multiple matches occur. To facilitate this, the will be called.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_MultiMatchOption.ModifyAll
member.summary: Modify all matching entries (Push Fields action only) if multiple matches occur.

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.SetEntryByQuery_MultiMatchOption.NoAction
member.summary: Do nothing (Push Fields action only) if multiple matches occur.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Server.MergeDuplicateOption

member.summary: 1 - Generate an error and throw an exception

member.summary: 3 - Overwrite the existing record

member.name: F:BMC.ARSystem.Server.MergeDuplicateOption.UpdateExisting
member.summary: 4 - Update the existing record, merging the field values

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Session
member.summary: This class can be used when dealing with workflow objects that involve references to multiple AR servers. For example when retrieving an active link which is attached to a form on one server, while some of its actions such as open window, set/push fields etc refer to forms of another server -- then if a client program were to retrieve such objects, it needs to be connected to both of the servers in deciphering the said workflow object. In such a use case, a client program must instantiate a Session instance, then add BMC.ARSystem.Server as many of them (each connecting to one server) to it, and there after attempt retrieval of such workflow objects. Beyond this, client program does not have to do any thing with this Session object; rest of the things transparently happen under the covers.

member.name: P:BMC.ARSystem.StructureItem.SelectedElements
member.summary: The server only uses this parameter during export and import actions. During export actions, this parameter is only used when exporting data of the following types: AR_STRUCT_ITEM_SCHEMA_MAIL - Specifies the VUI mail template to export. During import actions, this parameter is only used when importing data of one type: AR_STRUCT_ITEM_VUI - Specifies the VUIs to export and import from the schema. Specify the schema name in the name parameter. If the selected elements list is empty, all schema VUIs are exported.

member.name: T:BMC.ARSystem.Vui.MemberFlags
member.summary: Enumeration identifying each member attribute of the vui. This enumeration and a bit vector are used in conjunction to track the set of members that need to be saved during a SetFilter. This Filter has implementation to track its member modifications that may have been done using setters on its instance. So usually client programs need not work with this MemberFlags. However, if a client program does a GetFilter to fetch an object from server, alters some of its contents, then attempts to save (perhaps on a different server, or on a different form (for fields, vuis etc), or, with a different name) - in this case, the Filter's change tracking implementation comes in the way of the client program's expectations. This implementation would result in sending only the explicitly updated member values back to server. To overcome this issue, client programs can set the MembersModifiedusing this enumeration to force marking all the members as modified (dirty) and thus will all be sent to server upon save attempt.
